data.enText: the act of persuading sb to do sth or to believe sth

data.chText: 我们没费什么口舌就让她说出了他的下落。
data.enText: It didn't take much persuasion to get her to tell us where he was.

data.chText: 耐心劝说一下，他就同意来了。
data.enText: After a little gentle persuasion, he agreed to come.
She has great powers of persuasion.
a particular set of beliefs, especially about religion or politics

tr: a personal belief or judgment that is not founded on proof or certainty
example: I am not of your persuasion
what are your thoughts on Haiti?

tr: the act of persuading (or attempting to persuade)
communication intended to induce belief or action

value.def: Persuasion is the act of persuading someone to do something or to believe that something is true.

example.ex: Only after much persuasion from Ellis had she agreed to hold a show at all...
example.tran: 埃利斯劝了她半天后她才同意办一场展览。

example.ex: She was using all her powers of persuasion to induce the Griffins to remain in Rollway.
example.tran: 她在极力劝说格里芬斯一家留在罗尔威。

value.def: If you are of a particular persuasion, you have a particular belief or set of beliefs.

example.ex: It is a national movement and has within it people of all political persuasions...
example.tran: 这是一场全国性运动，参加者的政治信仰各不相同。

example.ex: Fortunately for me, my kids are of the persuasion that their failings are of their own making.
example.tran: 对我来说幸运的是,我的孩子们相信失败是他们自己造成的。
